meanings.sent1: The galling noise of the dripping faucet kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: It is galling when someone cuts in line in front of you.
meanings.sent3: It was galling to realize I had forgotten my lunch at home.
meanings.sent4: The galling behavior of the rude customer left everyone in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The galling itch from the mosquito bite made it hard to focus on anything else.

meanings.sent1: Her galling remarks made everyone uncomfortable at the party.
meanings.sent2: The galling delay in the train schedule made him late for work.
meanings.sent3: It was galling to see someone else take credit for my hard work.
meanings.sent4: The galling injustice of the situation left him feeling helpless.
meanings.sent5: The galling traffic jam seemed never-ending on the way home.

meanings.definition: A source of vexation or annoyance
meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site was a galling to the residents.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with his constant complaints became a galling for his friends.
meanings.sent3: The galling of having to wait in long lines at the amusement park was worth it for the rides.
meanings.sent4: The galling of having to repeat himself multiple times frustrated the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The galling of the broken elevator made climbing the stairs a daily challenge.
